resources.string:
Start e.g. via `eth -b -j --json-rpc-port 8079`

You can either do this on a PC or a Ξπ: Ξthereum on Raspberry Pi Or if you want to run it on this mobile you might be able compile the c++ version via the Android NDK or the go version this way. You just need the cli versions - as mist or alethzero might have nasty dependencies like QT
Contact me when you have a solution so I can link it from here or even better send a PullRequest

If you wonder what this is all about you might read the white-paper or watch this TED talk and dig deeper later
